result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF475, 21CM139, 22CF273 called at 11:09am
Defendant Bryan G Lord appeared by zoom from Walworth County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Cassi Nelson appeared by zoom from the courtroom for Bryan G Lord.  Attorney Krysta Parson appears by zoom from the courtroom for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews the court record. 

Atty Nelson requests additional time to contact Mr. Lord. 

Mr. Lord indicates that he wishes to proceed to pro-se. 

Mr. Lord states he was found competent in Walworth or Waukesha Co.

The Court sets hearing after review hearing in Walworth Co. 

Mr. Lord states he may or may not be in Walworth County at time of next hearing. 
recess: 11:17am 
NEXT: Status on 10/25/22 at 10:00am

records.addlTxt: Att Huebner
Att Nelson
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/10) ML
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] cases #21CF475, #21CM139, #22CF273 called at 8:36am 
Defendant Bryan G Lord in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case #22CF273 is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however Attorney Huebner indicates that Mr. Lord is asking for new counsel. Attorney Huebner also indicates he is aware that competency has been raised in a pending Waukesha case.
Mr. Lord makes a statement that he is asking that the Preliminary Hearing proceed today in Case #22CF273, and that thereafter Public Defender appoint Attorney Pablo Galaviz as his new counsel.  
After further statements are made by Mr. Lord, the Court indicates that it will not proceed with the Preliminary Hearing today.
Mr. Lord states he is firing Attorney Huebner.
The Court allows Attorney Huebner to withdraw as counsel. 
recess 8:44am

NEXT:  (1) clerk- remove Attorney Huebner as counsel and please add the PD Office to the mailing matrix, (2) Status Conference on October 4th at 11:00am [JA-note in comments that Case #22CF273 is at prelim stage]--arrangements are to be made for Mr. Lord to appear remotely (by telephone if in the Waukesha County Jail, or by v/c if at a different facility)
Order to Produce defendant - Prelim - 08-04-22

[MK] cases #21CF475, #21CM139, #22CF273 called at 9:19am 
Defendant Bryan G Lord does not appear.  Attorney Karl E Huebner appears by Zoom video. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Cases #21CF475 and #21CM139 are scheduled for Status Conference today, and Case #22CF273 is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however ADA Teuber indicates that the State filed to prepare a writ for Mr. Lord's transport from the Waukesha County Jail. ADA Teuber requests rescheduling. 
recess 9:22am.  

NEXT:  Status Conference in Cases #21CF475 and #21CM139, and Preliminary Hearing in Case #22CF273--all on August 4th at 8:30am; the State is to prepare a writ

Order to Seal Victim Key

[ae] case called  01:15 PM Defendant Bryan G Lord appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Barteck (the PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500 CASH  Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at Victim 1's residence
--no possession of any dangerous weapons 
--no acts or threats of violence

recess 1:25 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/13/22 at 9:00 am (2) Preliminary Hearing on 7/26/22 at 8:30 am in person appearances
Based on Judicial Rotation Order and the defendant having other pending cases in Br. 3.
